title: CT/MRI heart isolation using a graph cut algorithm
abstract: A method and related system for automatically and efficiently isolating the heart in Computer Tomography (CT) or Magnetic Resonance Imaging cardiac scans is disclosed. The method involves segmenting a heart within a set of volumetric data. In accordance with one aspect of the present invention, the set of volumetric data is processed to determine the minimum value of an energy function having a first term, a second term and a third term. The heart is segmented based on the processing of the set of volumetric data.
claims:
1. A method for segmenting a heart within a set of volumetric data, comprising:
processing the set of volumetric data to determine the minimum value of an energy function; and,
segmenting the surface of heart based on the processing of the set of volumetric data.
2. The method as claimed in claim 1, wherein the energy function has a first term, a second term and a third term.
3. The method as claimed in claim 2, wherein the first term measures how much a pair of neighboring pixels look alike in the set of data and the second term measures how much the value at a pixel resembles the expected appearance of an object.
4. The method as claimed in claim 3, wherein the third term favors edges that are orthogonal in any radial direction.
5. The method as claimed in claim 2, wherein one of the three terms favors edges that are orthogonal in a radial direction.
